tests.name: Let's begin!
tests.description: Click 'Next' to proceed to the first lesson

tests.name: Add <title> tag content
tests.description: Add your name to <title> tag so that it reads 'Teachstack'.

tests.name: Write your name inside a <h1> tag
tests.description: Add your first heading in the body of the HTML file by writing your name between an open and closed h1 tag.

tests.name: Add a link to the Teachstack website
tests.description: Use the <a> tag to add a link to the Teachstack website (https://www.teachstack.io) with the text 'Visit Teachstack'.

tests.name: Add an input tag to collect user name
tests.description: Use the <input> tag to collect a user's name. The input field should have placeholder text that says 'Enter your name'.

tests.name: Add three more headings using h4, h5, and h6 tags
tests.description: Expand your website by adding three additional headings using the h4, h5, and h6 tags. Each heading should contain any text of your choice.

tests.name:
Add two paragraphs using the

tag
tests.description: Add two paragraphs to your webpage under any of the existing headings. Each paragraph should contain any text of your choice.

tests.name: Write your to-do list
tests.description: Use an unordered list to write three items on your to-do list for tomorrow.

tests.name: List your top three favorite movies
tests.description: Use an ordered list to rank your top three favorite movies.

tests.name: Add a link to the Lists page
tests.description: Use a relative path to create a link to the Lists page with the text 'Lists'.

tests.name: Add a link to the Contact page
tests.description: Use a relative path to create a link to the Contact page with the text 'Newsletter'.

tests.name: Name the blank button
tests.description: Add some text to the first button on the page so that it reads 'click me'.

tests.name: Change the colour of the red button
tests.description: Change the style attribute of the red button and make it a different colour.

tests.name: Add another row to the table
tests.description: Add another entry to the table, defining an id, name and age.

tests.name: Double the border width of the table
tests.description: Increase the border width of the table to 2 pixels by modifying the CSS in the <style> tag.

tests.name: Embed the man-working.jpg image in the webpage
tests.description: Use an image tag to embed the image stored in your website's local directory.

tests.name: Adjust the size of the image
tests.description: Use attributes to make the image 300 pixels wide and 200 pixels tall.

tests.name: Add a new section of content containing a paragraph of text
tests.description:
Use the
tag to create a new section on the webpage. Inside this section, add a paragraph of text using the

tag.

tests.name: Add styling to the new section
tests.description: Add attributes to the <div> tag to give it a background color of your choice and a border.

tests.name: Let's begin!
tests.description: Click 'Next' to proceed to the first lesson

tests.name: Add a single-line comment
tests.description: Add a single-line comment to the file, with whatever content you like.

tests.name: Add a multi-line comment
tests.description: Add a multi-line comment to the file, with whatever content you like.

tests.name: Try using single quotes to print
tests.description: Add an extra 'Hello World JS' console.log that uses single quotes (').

tests.name: Add a semicolon
tests.description: Use a semicolon at the end of one of your console.log statements and see what happens.

tests.name: Print a string variable
tests.description: Print a string variable to the console.

tests.name: Print an integer variable
tests.description: Print an integer variable to the console.

tests.name: Print a boolean variable
tests.description: Print a boolean variable to the console.

tests.name: Print a decimal variable
tests.description: Print a decimal variable to the console.

tests.name: Print a date
tests.description: Print a date variable to the console.

tests.name: Print an object variable
tests.description: Print an object variable to the console.

tests.name: Print an undefined variable
tests.description: Print an undefined variable to the console.

tests.name: Print the datatype of each variable
tests.description: Use the 'typeof' operator to print the datatype of each variable.

tests.test: print the length of a string
tests.name: Print the length of a string
tests.description: Find the length of a string with the .length property and print the result.

tests.name: Print an uppercase string
tests.description: Convert a string with the .toUpperCase() method and print the result.

tests.name: Print a concatenated string
tests.description: Concatenate two strings with the '+' operator and print the result.

tests.name: Create an object
tests.description: Define an object that includes a string, number, boolean, decimal, date, and nested object property.

tests.name: Print a property
tests.description: Use console.log to print one property from your object.

tests.name: Print all values
tests.description: Use Object.values to print all values from your object as an array.
